fields.description: See attached screenshots
fields.summary: svn.atlassian.com/fisheye watch emails link to a page that no longer exists

fields.description:
In two different cases, administrators reported that fisheye was not scanning certain areas of the repositories, but there were no errors and the repository settings were correct. 

Later we checked the repository defaults to find that some other person had accidentally defined an includes or excludes and not cleaned it up. 

Any repository default settings should be displayed when viewing the repository to reduce confusion. 

Fisheye knowledge base entry opened for this issue:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHKB/Fisheye+does+not+scan+all+of+the+repository
fields.summary: Display Repository Default Includes and Excludes, when viewing repositories, so users can see what rules are being applied.

fields.description:
When refactoring code, often several lines will get pulled out of one method and added to a new one or vice versa. In simple diff tools, these changes are frequently annotated as deletes and adds (or confoundingly with the intervening code marked up as added and deleted), but they can be shown as moved-from and moved-to instead. Showing them with this extra info would help reviewers ignore the code (if they trust the existing code), or to find where it got to (if they've found an existing bug and are checking if it got fixed). In the browser, these code motion annotations could be hyperlink anchors within the file to make it easy to jump to and from the old and new locations.

Implementing this in the surrounding tools such as blame would also help track down the code long after any refactoring happened.
fields.summary: Show moved lines specially in diffs

fields.description: See: [https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/changelog/FE/?cs=54168#c83]
fields.summary: Merge studio crowd classloader fix from 1.6.x

fields.description:
Basically, the commit time in the code metric doesn't match with the one in svn server.See the following information

- Svn info and log, notice the commit time for rev 1 is {{2010-06-16 18:11:31 +0800 (Wed, 16 Jun 2010)}}
{noformat}
C:\>svn info file:///c:/MyRepo
Path: MyRepo
URL: file:///C:/MyRepo
Repository Root: file:///C:/MyRepo
Repository UUID: b5fa1f92-d849-5e49-947a-824f610ae6e2
Revision: 1
Node Kind: directory
Last Changed Author: MG
Last Changed Rev: 1
Last Changed Date: 2010-06-16 18:11:31 +0800 (Wed, 16 Jun 2010)


C:\>svn log -v -r head file:///c:/MyRepo
------------------------------------------------------------------------
r1 | MG | 2010-06-16 18:11:31 +0800 (Wed, 16 Jun 2010) | 1 line
Changed paths:
   A /trunk
   A /trunk/sample.txt
{noformat}
- [Server timezone settings|^server_timezone.png] in fisheye
- [Source view|^source-view.png] in Fisheye shows the valid time commit
- [Code metrics|^code-metric.png] shows an invalid time commit
fields.summary: Commit time is invalid in the code metrics report

fields.description: When using the Flash based "Copy" option to copy source into the clipboard from the annotated source viewer each line that would begin whitespace instead begins with garbage.  This just pertains to the whitespace that starts at the beginning of a new line.  Example attached.  The problem becomes apparent when viewing the file with a hex editor.
fields.summary: Garbage is copied into the clipboard when using the Flash based Copy option in the annotated source viewer

fields.description: The product data that is available for the Atlassian Plugin SDK is too large.  It includes a large repository and an old backup, causing db upgrade tasks to run that take a long time.
fields.summary: Product data zip for AMPS is too large

fields.description:
Fisheye is generating RSS feed content which cannot be parsed by evolution. When a feed item like this is encountered the raw content of the item _after_ the first blank line is displayed instead of the item content.

This seems to occur only, but not always, if the commit comment contains a blank line.

The format of our commit comments is:
_<Summary>_
Issue: _<issue number>_
Reviewer: _<reviewer username>_

Attached are two fisheye feed items produced by viewing message source in evolution. One renders and the other does not, but both contained blank lines in the commit summary.

Perhaps fisheye should only use the first line of the commit comment as the message summary.
fields.summary: Invalid RSS feed items generated by fisheye

fields.description:
I'm trying to get UPM working in Fisheye and running into some roadblocks.  When starting up Fisheye 2.3.2 everything seemed to be going fine, but Fisheye appeared to "hang" on startup.  It still appeared to be active, so there weren't any deadlocks.  I then cranked up the debugging and found these messages when UPM is being enabled.

{code}
2010-06-10 11:04:36,104 DEBUG [main] felix.FelixOsgiContainerManager FelixLoggerBridge-doLog - Constraint violation for 48.0 detected; module can see javax.xml.bind.annotation from [0] and javax.xml.bind.annotation from [0]
2010-06-10 11:04:36,106 DEBUG [main] felix.FelixOsgiContainerManager FelixLoggerBridge-doLog - Constraint violation for 48.0 detected; module can see javax.xml.bind.annotation from [0] and javax.xml.bind.annotation from [0]
2010-06-10 11:04:36,108 DEBUG [main] felix.FelixOsgiContainerManager FelixLoggerBridge-doLog - Constraint violation for 48.0 detected; module can see javax.xml.bind.annotation from [0] and javax.xml.bind.annotation from [0]
2010-06-10 11:04:36,111 DEBUG [main] felix.FelixOsgiContainerManager FelixLoggerBridge-doLog - Constraint violation for 48.0 detected; module can see javax.xml.bind.annotation from [0] and javax.xml.bind.annotation from [0]
2010-06-10 11:04:36,113 DEBUG [main] felix.FelixOsgiContainerManager FelixLoggerBridge-doLog - Constraint violation for 48.0 detected; module can see com.atlassian.sal.api.message from [33.0] and com.atlassian.sal.api.message from [13.0]
2010-06-10 11:04:36,115 DEBUG [main] felix.FelixOsgiContainerManager FelixLoggerBridge-doLog - Constraint violation for 48.0 detected; module can see com.atlassian.sal.api.message from [33.0] and com.atlassian.sal.api.message from [13.0]
2010-06-10 11:04:36,117 DEBUG [main] felix.FelixOsgiContainerManager FelixLoggerBridge-doLog - Constraint violation for 48.0 detected; module can see com.atlassian.sal.api.message from [33.0] and com.atlassian.sal.api.message from [13.0]
2010-06-10 11:04:36,119 DEBUG [main] felix.FelixOsgiContainerManager FelixLoggerBridge-doLog - Constraint violation for 48.0 detected; module can see com.atlassian.sal.api.message from [33.0] and com.atlassian.sal.api.message from [13.0]
{code}

That repeats over and over in an infinite loop until Fisheye is killed.

I'm not sure wtf is going on with the javax.xml.bind.annotation violation.  I do see in FisheyePluginManagerFactory that you export javax.* from the system classloader, but that should be fine afaik.  Why it's complaining that it's finding the same package exported from the same bundle - the system bundle, in this case - I really don't understand.  Unless that is conflicting with something hardcoded in the plugins system.

The second set of messages, about com.atlassian.sal.api.message being available from 2 bundles is more disturbing.  I did some looking and the sal-api packages do, in fact, appear in 2 places in Fisheye: 1) the sal-api jar is a bundled plugin, and 2) the sal-api jar is bundled in the META-INF/lib directory of the sal-fisheye-plugin.  The first packaging, as a bundled plugin, is correct.  The second one will cause all kinds of problems as the implementation in the sal-fisheye-plugin will use it's internal packages.  To avoid this problem, it appears the sal-fisheye-plugin also exports the sal-api packages, but it does this without any versioning.  I think this is the cause of the problem that I am seeing.

I would recommend one of 2 approaches here: 1) Don't package the sal-api jar in the sal-fisheye-plugin, or 2) if you want to bundle the sal-api jar in the sal-fisheye-plugin to avoid the extra bundle, get rid of the sal-api jar as a bundled plugin and make sure to fix the sal-fisheye-plugin manifest to export the sal-api packages with proper versioning.
fields.summary: SAL API packages not properly exported

fields.description:
See this blogpost for background info http://benjchristensen.com/2008/05/27/mysql-jdbc-memory-usage-on-large-resultset/

The mysql JDBC driver loads a complete result set into the JVM heap which can cause heap exhaustion of excessive garbage collection on large databases. It is possible to put the JDBC driver into a streaming mode to reduce the memory usage.
fields.summary: Reduce memory usage of mysql backup process

fields.description:
Applies to date fields in particular.

Raised in [FSH-3882|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/FSH-3882].
fields.summary: Charts should give error messages for invalid input rather than silently ignoring it
use safe parameter interceptor

fields.description:
If you create two repos that differ only in case, weird stuff happens. In the image below the Hg repo is linked to hg.  

!http://img.skitch.com/20100607-xx16nr2yechsstdsgdk7k68x6n.jpg!
fields.summary: Repository names are case sensitive in some place, case insensitive in others.

fields.description:
With GIT, people tends to create a lot of clone.
When adding the main repository and all clones in Fisheye it would be usefull to be able to:
- Simplify indexing in case a large part of the history is common.
- Ability to see all changes across all clones.
- Ability to diff the same file between clones.
fields.summary: Ability to have manage a GIT repository and its clones

fields.description:
When using GIT, you tend to clone the same code base for different needs.
What would be needed in that context is a way to diff the history of the same file in two repositories.
It allows to see what is missing in one another, which commit is missed, etc.
fields.summary: Ability to diff the same file in different repository

fields.description:
I think it would be very handy if linked JIRA issues could exist in its own distinct field.

I believe it would be very beneficial for searching purposes.
fields.summary: Make linked JIRA issues a distinct field

fields.description:
In one of the Mercurial repositories with which I am evaluating FishEye, opening the Activity tab upon initially browsing the repository fails to show the most recently committed changeset.

Navigating to a file committed in that changeset also fails to show the most recent changeset in the Activity tab, however switching to the Revisions tab does show the changeset.  This demonstrates that FishEye is viewing an up-to-date clone of the correct revision of the Mercurial repository.

This problem does not occur with another (simpler) Mercurial repository.  One significant difference between the two repositories is that the repository exhibiting the problem is itself a clone of another repository.
fields.summary: Mercurial: All activity does not show the most recent commit in one repository

fields.description:
Currently, from version 2.3.x onwards, the [Latest Activity column|http://screencast.com/t/YjZhYjJmM] has been removed. This is a temporary measure to improve the performance of the source tab page.

It would be good to have an option to enable it.
fields.summary: An option to enable the "Latest Activity" column
Use Clearcase COM object as interface for cleartool commands in Windows

fields.description:
In Studio, we configured each repository to have a wiki linker that matches the link pattern (i.e. "\[page name\]") and replaces it with a link to a Confluence page that belongs to a space that is applinked to the repository.

After upgrade to FECRU 2.2.3, this fails to work because the link resolver interpret this as a URL link.
fields.summary: The link resolver in Crucible's wiki renderer does not consult the repository's configured linkers

fields.description:
Please see the attached screenshots.  It appears that in Fisheye 2.3.x we have lost the ability to rescan revisions of a repository.  I have tested this locally on Subversion and a customer has reported it also on Perforce.

In addition, the indexer documentation is out of date (see screenshot):  http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Indexer

fields.description:
Re-produce steps :

# Integrate with LDAP 
# Create a local group e.g Jira, and assign few members into Jira group.
# Grant Jira group to access a repo, e.g svnRepo1
# Use the authentication test in LDAP,
* Jira member, showing has access to svnRepo1 
* non Jira member, showing has access to svnRepo1 (this is wrong)

In fact, if non Jira member login FE, he is unable to view the svnRepo1. This is correct.
The authentication test should provide accurate results which tested for local group access as well.
fields.summary: Authentication test does not taking local groups into account

fields.description:
One of the things we tell customers to do in support is split up huge repositories into multiple FishEye repositories (e.g. by "component") so that they can be scanned in parallel and at least parts of your repo will be available without having to wait days/weeks.  

It would be nice if we could group related repositories together similar to what JIRA allows you to do with Project categories. This would be useful in conjunction with FE-2523.
fields.summary: Allow repositories to be grouped together

fields.description: Like there is a time zone issue, but crucible is set to CDT, the server its running on is CDT, SVN is CDT.
fields.summary: Source Code Metrics show incorrect time (Commit Time / Volume)

fields.description:
FishEye is currently assuming that ClearCase version identifers are in the format of _path@@version_.  However, if a version is not available in the current view (for example, if the element has been deleted by a later version), then the version identifier is in the format of _path@@sub path@@version_.  

FishEye should handle parsing the version identifier information in both cases.
fields.summary: FishEye needs to be able handle identifiers for versions that are not available in the current view

fields.description:
We changed the startup script in 2.2.3 to handle spaces in the FISHEYE_HOME directory: 

{noformat}[amyers@erdinger:fecru-2.2.3]$ diff bin/fisheyectl.bat ../fecru-2.2.1/bin/fisheyectl.bat 
44c44
< For /F "Tokens=*" %%I in ('"%_JAVACMD%" -cp "%FISHEYE_HOME%\fisheyeboot.jar" com.cenqua.fisheye.boot.OptsSetter') Do Set FISHEYE_OPTS=%%I
---
> For /F "Tokens=*" %%I in ('"%_JAVACMD%" -cp %FISHEYE_HOME%/fisheyeboot.jar com.cenqua.fisheye.boot.OptsSetter') Do Set FISHEYE_OPTS=%%I{noformat} 

This results in an error: "The filename, directory name, or volume label syntax is incorrect."
fields.summary: fisheyectl.bat is broken on windows

fields.description:
Since Base ClearCase does not have a concept of a 'change set', FishEye groups commits made by each user and all the commits made within a second of each other are treated as a change set. FishEye is also storing the number of changes in the database, and upon reindexing, compares the number of items in the changeset to the number previously stored (this is required for the ClearCase UCM support, as UCM activities, which are used as the change sets may be updated after being indexed).

If more than one user has committed changes at the same time, and these changesets have a different number of changes included, then FishEye will continually reindex these changes.
fields.summary: FishEye continually reindexes Base ClearCase changesets made at the same time by different users

fields.description:
Generally, the git branch called 'master' in git iirc. If you happen to rename it with a different name, the LoC chart that shows trunk LoC will be empty.

Ideally, we should have an option to allow another git branch to be specified as the default.
fields.summary: Allow another git branch to be specified as the default

fields.description: FishEye currently indexes all streams within a UCM Project.  FishEye should allow users to specify specific streams to include/exclude from the indexing process
fields.summary: Allow users to include/exclude specific UCM Streams from indexing

fields.description: From http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?threadID=43900&tstart=0
fields.summary: Links to Jira issues specified in Activity not appearing

fields.description:
I am recieving the following exception when attempting to use the quick search function with Fisheye.  Any help would be appreciated.

500 Server Error

FishEye was unable to process your request.
com.cenqua.fisheye.rep.DbException

org.apache.lucene.index.CorruptIndexException: doc counts differ for segment _134j: fieldsReader shows 43372 but segmentInfo shows 43373

You are running release CR1.6.6 FE1.6.6 (build-376 2009-02-12), please report your release number when reporting bugs.
fields.summary: org.apache.lucene.index.CorruptIndexException when using quick search

fields.description: FishEye processes the UCM Project and Activity information to determine the changes that need to be indexed for a repository.  As UCM activities may be derived from common activities, FishEye is issuing the same cleartool commands multiple times.  It should instead cache the information for the duration of the indexing operation.
fields.summary: UCM Activity/Project information should be cached to stop FishEye re-requesting the same information

fields.description:
The ClearCase administration options have been updated in version 2.2.3, and the corresponding documentation will need to be updated to reflect the new options.

I will update the internal EAC pages to include the rough outlines of the changes, and I'll update this issue when the changes have been finished.
fields.summary: Update ClearCase documentation information

fields.description:
{noformat}

fields.summary: NullPointerException generated occaisionally when source is viewed
Error retrieiving type manager for multi-level VOBs

fields.description:
Processed changesets are being reindexed when subsequent change sets are processed.  This has the effect of slowing down the indexing process considerably.

This only applies to the Lucene (ie. text searching) indexing - the actual change set information itself is not reprocessed.
fields.summary: Lucene indexing of change sets is being repeatedly performed

fields.description: See [Erik's comment|https://extranet.atlassian.com/crucible/cru/CR-FE-3426#c30326] on the DiffService review.
fields.summary: REST resource for DiffService

fields.description:
From my ShipIt 14 shipment order:

{quote}FishEye/Crucible plugin developers have access to APIs for getting [content|http://docs.atlassian.com/fisheye-crucible/2.1.0/javadoc/com/atlassian/fisheye/spi/services/ContentService.html], [changesets|http://docs.atlassian.com/fisheye-crucible/2.1.0
javadoc/com/atlassian/fisheye/spi/services/RecentChangesetsService.html], [etc.|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FECRUDEV/Java+API], but no API to get diffs of a file the way FishEye does internally.  This is a basic necessity for any FishEye/Cruci
le plugin that needs to filter its input or output to only those lines of code that FishEye reports as added, removed or changed (or unchanged, for that matter).  For example, the Checkstyle and Clover plugins for Crucible would probably like to issue reports on only the changed code.{quote}

 I implemented this and now I am hoping to do whatever is necessary to get my code into FishEye.
fields.summary: SPI diff service

fields.description:
To configure an outbound proxy server FishEye needs some JVM options to be passed via FISHEYE_OPTS. 

Confluence has some [great documentation|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Configure+Web+Proxy+Support+for+Confluence] on this, but some customers would prefer an easier approach to do so.
fields.summary: Interface to configure outbound proxy

fields.description: Similar to the Subversion and Perforce repositories, FishEye should allow users to specify the throttle connections per second for a repository
fields.summary: Allow users to specify throttle connections for ClearCase repository

fields.description:
We use command-line backup to automate backup process
java memory options: -Xmx1536M -Xms1536M -XX:MaxPermSize=196M -server -Xshare:auto -XX:-UseGCOverheadLimit -XX:MaxNewSize=128m
command line for backup: /fisheyectl.sh backup --compression 9 -f ${BackUP_DIR}/${FSY_FILE}
As result of this command, we get broken zip (about 13 MiB) and OOME: see attached log fragment 

After this we get random exceptions in log, until we restart fisheye

We tried rise -Xmx to 2G, but result is same, and this is a limit on 32bit java, (64 bit java is not recommended for fisheye).

We tried backup via web-interface, same result: broken zip and OOME in logs

How can we do backups?
fields.summary: fisheye commandline backup result in OOME and broken zip-file

fields.description:
We've had some issues where someone broke Crowd (they changed the LDAP credentials it was using).

One nasty side effect of this is that fisheye stopped sending notifications out.  The real nuisance though is that all watchers appeared to be removed and needed adding back in manually.

I've afraid I've not got the full logs anymore but I can tell you this much:

(watcher error)
2010-04-14 00:00:00,097 ERROR [FE-WatchChecker] fisheye.app com.cenqua.fisheye.web.WatchManager$WatchChecker-checkWatchesForRep - Could not create trusted user login for user [mikeh]. Notification skipped for this user.
fields.summary: fisheye loses notifications upon crowd issues

fields.description: Forms in FishEye (and Crucible) in general lack IDs, which make Studio's tests flaky as we have to select the current form using a magic number.
fields.summary: Forms in admin screens lack IDs

fields.description:
Including rebase, deliver and propagation activities to the scan should
be optional. By convention such activities are named rebase., deliver. and
prop.* so it should be possible to implement. Besides, including them must be
bloating the actual LoC figure; I think nobody would need to review those anyway.
fields.summary: Clearcase - Including rebase, deliver and propagation activities to the scan should be optional

fields.description:
For a large project,
it should be made possible to index only commits of those users that we are
interested in. For example, it would be nice if it were possible to specify
a list of usernames to include/exclude. Users that have left the company or
ones that do not contribute to code (e.g. testers) can be left out from indexing.
This should also drastically improve scan time.
fields.summary: Clearcase - to allow include/exclude certain commited users for indexing

fields.description: The ClearCase support within FishEye currently only includes changes that have been delivered to a stream as part of it's indexing process.  Investigation into providing support for changes that have been checked in to a user's stream should be performed.
fields.summary: Include checked in versions that have not been delivered in repository index

fields.description:
When the 'Integration Streams Only' option is set to false, FishEye inspects the contents for each stream within the UCM project being indexed.  This leads to the duplication of commit information.

See https://support.atlassian.com/browse/FSH-3655
fields.summary: Duplicate comments shown for UCM Projects when 'Integration Streams Only' set to false

fields.description: The 'Updater' section in the ClearCase repository admin interface is currently blank - it should display the configuration options to allow the repository rescan options to be modified.
fields.summary: Repository rescan configuration options not visible

fields.description:
I am facing the same problem with Fisheye 2.2.1 version (while upgrading from 2.0.6 to this version).

The /fisheye context is not getting initialized due to this and thus not available through http. But on the back end side, I see that the fisheye is indexing all the repositories and is visible in the debug logs.

I tried downloading the artifacts again (as mentioned could be due to corrupt download), but that didn't resolve the problem.
fields.summary: Unable to install bundle - com.atlassian.plugin.osgi.container.OsgiContainerException:

fields.description: FishEye is not including version 0 versions (which represent version creations).  FishEye should check to see if a version 0 has source content and if so, should include these versions in the index
fields.summary: FishEye currently does not index version '0'

fields.description:
As per description, when a user is renamed, they will lose all the historical in the activity streams. 

This did not happen in 2.1.x.
fields.summary: When you rename a user you lose the user history in the activity stream
Add CAPTCHA-reset to admin interface

fields.description:
From https://support.atlassian.com/browse/FSH-3447?focusedCommentId=1083778&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels%3Acomment-tabpanel#action_1083778

If the users stops the repository in the middle of indexing and then starts the server again, it does not pick up where it left off rather it moves to the current day and only processes changes made in the current day.
fields.summary: Repository reindex performed after aborted index using incorrect start date

fields.description:
Steps to re-produce :

# Create a directory where name contains a space.
# Go to repo > directory > report tab > code metrics, you would see

{noformat}
No author blame found for MG-repo/testbranch%202010 - has the repository finished indexing?
No LOC data (by extension) found at MG-repo/testbranch%202010 - has the repository finished indexing?
{noformat}
fields.summary: No LOC or author data for directory name with space
Reduce size of FishEye's Lucene indexes

fields.description: (Remember-me cookies were made HttpOnly in FE-899)
fields.summary: Use HttpOnly cookies for session cookies

fields.description:
The code which checks the load rules for Base ClearCase repositories is parsing the lines from the config spec that begin with 'load' and assumes that the load rule specifies a VOB, wheras the path specified can actually refer to a subdirectory of the VOB. 

The VOB processing and inclusion rule logic needs to cater for subdirectories being specified in the config spec load rules.
fields.summary: Base ClearCase support should handle processing VOB subpaths when reusing snapshot views

fields.description: The Base ClearCase support creates snapshot views using the VOB name (appended with FishEye).  The view name should also include the Repository name so that users can create multiple repositories using the same VOB.
fields.summary: Use the Repository name when creating views for Base ClearCase projects

fields.description:
When executing the following query, the response time of the API is very slow (30+ second response time).

select revisions from dir / where (comment matches 'SIX' or p4:jobid =~ '(^|[^a-zA-Z0-9-])SIX-[0-9]+($|[^a-zA-Z0-9-])') and date > 2010-04-12T22:41:32Z order by date group by changeset return csid

This query is being used by JIRA/Fisheye Plugin to display the "Source" tab on a Project.
fields.summary: Fisheye API response time very slow when executing a query which is used by the JIRA Plugin

fields.description:
The performance improvements included in http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/FE-2323 has had the side effect of causing only changes made on the main branch to be indexed by FishEye.  

The ClearCase admin UI should be updated to provide a 'Main Branches Only' radio button, and if deselected (ie. process all branches), then the original (slower) history retrieval should be used.
fields.summary: Base ClearCase code is not processing all branches of a VOB
Symbolic links to fisheyectl.sh don't work

fields.description:
When page is rendered with fisheye.report.tab decorator and name of user contains some UTF-8 characters, these are rendered incorrectly (see attached picture).
Problem is in Attlasian "Code Metrics plugin" and in my plugin using same decorator too.
Other FE pages (non plugin) shows name of user correctly.
fields.summary: fisheye.report.tab decorator shows wrong name of user with UTF-8 characters

fields.description:
From https://support.atlassian.com/browse/FSH-3585

FishEye is executing 'cleartool catcs' when re-using an existing view and is expecting to parse lines beginning with 'load'.  This line does not exist in the config spec for dynamic views, and cause the repository index to not process any changes.
fields.summary: FishEye fails to process changes for a dynamic view

fields.description: FishEye currently does not display information about the individual activities that are included in a deliver operation, only the actual 'deliver' activities.
fields.summary: Display information of UCM activities that contributed to a deliver operation

fields.description:
This feature request added regarding your reply on https://support.atlassian.com/browse/FSH-3548

I'd like to add some functionality into FishEye as new subtab to 'Source' main menu item (beside existing 'Repositories' and 'Activity' subtabs). There is no web-item section identifier available for this location, and there is not appropriate decorator too. Should you please define them?

Thanks

Vl.
fields.summary: web item location for adding tabs to the source page

fields.description:
JIRA Studio imports these three components, which are not published anymore in FECRU 2.2.1.1. Consequently, Studio's plugin could not be activated due to unsatisfied dependencies.

Attached is a patch to spring-components.xml to publish these components as OSGi services, patched against 2.2.1.1-build-468.
fields.summary: sal-fisheye-plugin not publishing fisheyeAccessor, fisheyeCommitAccessor and fisheyeUserManagerAccessor as OSGi service

fields.description: The most obvious way to search in FishEye is to use the search field in the top right corner.  Once that search hasn't found what I want, the next step is to do an advanced search.  Not only is there no link to advanced search from the quick search screen, but looking at the doc: [http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/FISHEYE/Searching+the+Repository#SearchingtheRepository-SimpleSearch] it sounds like I have to go through about 4 steps to get there.
fields.summary: It should be possible to do an advanced search from the quick search screen

fields.description:
We are running into issues when we create new branches in Perforce because it takes about one hour to index the new branch. This causes downtime for our developers who check in code after and have to wait for the new branch index to complete. I have tried setting up the repository so I put the include in after the branch is created however even if I restart the repository Fisheye will not pick up this new branch. The only way it seems to work is that if I create the include first, then restart and then branch. However the latter does not give us any benefit.

We would like to branch the code in Perforce, then setup the include during off hours and run the index for just that one branch.  Currently it seems like when you rescan changelists it only does the metadata and not the content.  Is there anyway to fully index a branch that was created in the past by setting up an include without having to reindex the entire repository?
fields.summary: Index branch after creation

fields.description: Add a 'select all' checkbox to delete user in bulk instead of check one by one
fields.summary: To have a select all checkbox to delete user in bulk

fields.description:
Refer to [FSH-3526|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/FSH-3526]

{quote}
Consider I am viewing the "annotated" page for a file (let's call it "allan"), it's the latest revision of that file.
If I click on any other file (let's call it "zoidberg") on the left, fisheye may present me the same revision number of zoidberg like it did with allan. But that makes not much sense in my eyes, as

    * two files having the same revision will most likely be caused by two different cvs-commits
    * zoidberg may not have yet a revision as high as allan, "no such revision" will be raised
    * even if zoidberg has a revision like allan does, it is most likely not the latest revision of zoidberg

My humble proposal: When in "Annotated" view, clicking on another file will always take you to the latest "annotated" revision of that other file 
{quote}
fields.summary: The error "The requested resource cannot be found" is thrown when switching the "annotated" view for different files

fields.description: When processing version deletions, the author information for the initial checkin is used instead of the author information for the deletion checkin.
fields.summary: Incorrect author information being used when processing version deletions

fields.description:
Currently we scan everything in a git repo. If you have particular branches you only want to show up in FishEye, you are out of luck because the includes/excludes work on directories and with git we don't need to create a physical directory as per subversion. 

So if I something like: 

{noformat}git branch projects/project1
git branch projects/project2
git branch projects/project3
{noformat}

And I may only wish to include say projects 1 and 3 then I can't do so.
fields.summary: Allow Include / Exclude of Git branches

fields.description:
From https://support.atlassian.com/browse/FSH-3503

FishEye currently only processes changes made to 'main' branches.  It should process all changes made on any branch within the VOB
fields.summary: FishEye only processes 'main' branches

fields.description: Currently, the public hosting instances are very old. It doesn't support the later scm such as GIT. We should upgrade it to the latest version.
fields.summary: Upgrade fisheye public hosting instances to version 2.2.1

fields.description:
From https://support.atlassian.com/browse/FSH-3488

1. for projects, on repository page, we have to add section "Config Spec" and generate view with Config Spec(CS), use index parameters for VOBs in VOBs section (with separators)
They are changes will be better for using more then one VOB for project.
2. for access to developers changes we have to create new dynamic view with developers Config Spec(CS)
fields.summary: Provide ability for users to specify the config spec to be used for the auto created views

fields.description:
A customer would like to be able to do cross referencing of the code base to find out where certain definitions might come from. 

Something similar to this, but less clunky.

http://lxr.linux.no/#linux+v2.6.33/mm/highmem.c

Perhaps we could highlight a code fragment in the annotated view and click a button to do a quick search on the repo similar to the copy to clipboard functionality?
fields.summary: Cross referencing source code

fields.description:
Currently we hardcode a 5 second limit. Some customers would like to make the configurable:

{quote}In addition to those feature requests I'd like the time limit for quick search to no longer be hard coded. This parameter should be configurable by the administrators since they are in a much better position to understand the impact to the specific deployed infrastructure. The administrator should be able to totally disable the time limit (e.g. set to zero/-1) to all full searching across all repos.
{quote}

I tend to think perhaps a similar approach to the dashboard where we timeout the data aggregation and then offer the user to increase the timeout. Allow this up until the maximum set.
fields.summary: Configurable timeout for cross repo quick search.

fields.description:
Users have reported the following error occurring during the repository indexing process (the error only seems to occur on Unix/Linux based installations):

{code}
2010-03-22 09:18:06,981 WARN  [btpool0-19] fisheye.app ClearCaseContext-handleProcessError - Error executing command (cleartool get -to /opt/atlassian/fisheye_data/var/tmp/84e95afe.32ad11df.8315.000184f0dc5c.tmp "vobs/epo_toolsmithing/jepdev_tools/scm_team/eposam/src/eposam.cpp@@/main/16" ) :  cleartool: Error: ""vobs/epo_toolsmithing/jepdev_tools/scm_team/eposam/src/eposam.cpp@@/main/16"" does not exist, or is not a ClearCase version,
or is a checked out version which was removed.

2010-03-22 09:18:06,999 ERROR [btpool0-19] fisheye.app ClearCaseContext-retrieveContent - Unable to open file: /opt/atlassian/fisheye_data/var/tmp/84e95afe.32ad11df.8315.000184f0dc5c.tmp indicating that cleartool get failed, attempting to continue processing
java.io.FileNotFoundException: /opt/atlassian/fisheye_data/var/tmp/84e95afe.32ad11df.8315.000184f0dc5c.tmp (No such file or directory)
	at java.io.FileInputStream.open(Native Method)
	at java.io.FileInputStream.<init>(FileInputStream.java:106)
	at com.atlassian.fisheye.clearcase.ClearCaseContext.retrieveContent(ClearCaseContext.java:538)
	at com.atlassian.fisheye.clearcase.ClearCaseRevisionCache.getBinaryRevision(ClearCaseRevisionCache.java:138)

fields.summary: FileNotFoundException generated when content is processed

fields.description:
Visit these two pages:
http://localhost:6060/crucible/browse/FE/trunk/src/java/com/cenqua/fisheye/obfuscate
http://localhost:6060/crucible/browse/FE/branches/2.2/src/java/com/cenqua/fisheye/obfuscate

trunk
!http://img.skitch.com/20100323-1wrifsheqjdm6r3f7c1dp5ytpr.jpg!

branch
!http://img.skitch.com/20100323-c8fasta87g4i53ttjtwpjw4mfb.jpg!

On trunk the directory has contents, and so data fills the content pane.
On the branch, there's apparently no contents - which is legitimate - but there's equally no message returned to tell the user this. Just an empty screen.

We need feedback.

Similarly, there may need to be a change in the iconography and response from the tree. Perhaps a directory icon without the twixie and a removal of the open/close mechanism?

If you ensure that the empty message returned matches the structure of HTML from a typical response, the thead locking method will accommodate seamlessly.
fields.summary: No details or message are returned from the Browse page ajax request when the directory is empty

fields.description:
Supposedly, this is already fixed in the version 2.2 as it's not reproducible there.  

Reproduction:

Download ZIP Archive from this link:
https://studio.plugins.atlassian.com/source/browse/SVN/tags/atlassian_jira_4_1-rc1

ZIP is empty.
fields.summary: Archive download produces empty zip file when downloading from area other than trunk

fields.summary: NullPointerException generated when repository index is processed

fields.description:
At the moment the quick search uses either all the repos in an instance, or a single repo. The problem with that is that if you want to search from something over multiple repos (but not all) there is a good chance you will hit the 5 second limit and perhaps miss out on the results you actually want.

It would be good if you could specify which repositories are to be to be searched in a cross repo search.

As an extension, it would also be beneficial if there is also an "exclude" option, so users can search all repositories except a few specified.
fields.summary: Allow specific repositories to be used for cross repository quick search

fields.description: You will need to restart FishEye before any of the [server settings|http://confluence.atlassian.com/x/doCDBQ] take effect. It would be great to include a warning message e.g "Restart is required" after changing the server settings
fields.summary: Add a warning "Restart is required" after changing the server settings

fields.description:
See image - the numeric column headers align left, the content right.

Also, the comment itself is in a div with a max width, so comment is truncated instead of filling available whitespace (FWIW, multi-line comments only ever show the first line, although all lines are in the DOM and accessible via download as CSV) - there is a title showing full unformatted comment however.

IMO, better to not set the table or cell widths and let it calculate it's best fit width (if there's a really long comment, user can reposition comment column in query to last)
fields.summary: Search Results table unreadable when few columns and wide screen

fields.description:
We're using Studio and have been trialling the Fisheye integration to browse SVN repositories. There are a few issues we've run into (I've already raised these as support questions). I'm not really sure if these are Fisheye or just specifically Studio issues.


*1. Single repository*
All of the projects in studio are in a single repository, which causes various weird things to occur, such as version numbers that jump around (the head version is for the last checkin of any project, rather than the project you are working on). I'm also not sure if you can do a partial dump (of directories rather than version numbers) - if you can't it would also mean that it is pretty hard to get any svn data back out once it is in. Which would suck.

*2. External repos*
Another issue has been an inability to have external repos (again - this might be just studio). It would be really nice to allow an external SVN. The actual Contegix hosting of studio has been great, but the SVN part is not so great:
* any changes or imports need to get done remotely, and these take about a day to actually get done
* the speed is very slow - our developers access our SVN now at 800-1000k/s, while the Contegix SVN is typically 100k/s. Webdav is even slower at about 5-10k/s


Perhaps these items were left out in order to ship Studio, but it would be much appreciated if we could get them added in.
fields.summary: Allow fisheye in studio to support multiple subversion repositories
